revised_title: William Thomas Astbury: A Pioneer in Molecular Biology and Crystallography
tldr: William Thomas Astbury was a prominent figure in the field of crystal structure analysis and molecular biology. He made significant contributions to the development of X-ray crystallography, including the Astbury-Yardley tables of space groups and the a-ray absorption intensity gauge. Astbury's work laid the foundation for the study of complex organic structures and played a crucial role in the growth of molecular biology as a scientific discipline.
